body: LEAD: Eleven present and one former employee at the Kingsboro Psychiatric Center in Brooklyn were arrested yesterday on charges of sale and possession of cocaine and marijuana or the abuse of patients. body: LEAD: AT 9 A.M. on Sept. 22 an auctioneer will bang his gavel in the auditorium of 1 Police Plaza in Manhattan and start the 38th auction of city-owned houses and small apartment buildings. body: LEAD: A Brooklyn man who was set on fire by a group of teen-agers in Prospect Park last week was arrested yesterday on warrants stemming from his failures to begin serving a sentence for burglary and to appear at an auto-theft hearing, the authorities said. A Brooklyn man who was set on fire by a group of teen-agers in Prospect Park last week was
title: Man Who Was Set On Fire in Brooklyn Is Seized as Fugitive

body: LEAD: Comparing the burning of a young couple in Prospect Park to the Howard Beach assault, Mayor Koch expressed shock yesterday at ''the lack of outrage'' being voiced about the park attack by the city's religious and civic leaders. Comparing the burning of a young couple in Prospect Park to the Howard Beach assault, Mayor Koch expressed shock
title: Koch Angered By Response To 2 Burnings

body: LEAD: Two people suffered burns yesterday morning after being set on fire as they slept in Prospect Park in Brooklyn, and the police said they were searching for five teen-agers seen by a man who awoke as liquid was being poured on him. Two people suffered burns yesterday morning after being set on fire as they slept in Prospect Park in Brooklyn,
title: 2 Asleep in Prospect Park Are Set Afire

body: LEAD: The New York City Board of Estimate is scheduled to vote at today's meeting on new zoning rules aimed at spurring construction of lower and bulkier apartment buildings throughout the city to meet the demand for middle-income housing. title: Vote Planned On New Rules For Low Units

body: LEAD: Thomas J. Cuite, who retired in 1985 after 16 years as majority leader of the New York City Council, died of a heart attack yesterday morning at Lutheran Medical Center in Brooklyn. title: THOMAS CUITE DIES OF A HEART ATTACK

body: LEAD: A MAJOR component of New York City's master plan to promote housing construction has been forwarded with broad, but not unqualified, support to the Board of Estimate, where it is scheduled for a public hearing on Thursday. title: Developing New Housing Standards
